title: Public Health and Economic Barriers in Idaho
author: Author A. B.
summary: This paper investigates the intersection of public health outcomes and socio-economic stressors in Idaho, focusing on how local income levels, housing costs, and education quality contribute to disparities in chronic disease, maternal health, and preventable hospital admissions.

statistical_analysis.findings: Counties in Idaho with the lowest income quartile were 2.2x more likely to report avoidable hospitalizations. Regions with underfunded school districts showed corresponding spikes in preventable disease burden (p < 0.01).

policy_implication: Findings emphasize the need for cross-sector policy solutions in Idaho including Medicaid expansion, educational reform, and targeted public health investments in low-income neighborhoods.
references: Idaho Socioeconomic and Health Impact Report

summary: This paper investigates the intersection of public health outcomes and socio-economic stressors in Illinois, focusing on how local income levels, housing costs, and education quality contribute to disparities in chronic disease, maternal health, and preventable hospital admissions.

statistical_analysis.findings: Counties in Illinois with the lowest income quartile were 2.2x more likely to report avoidable hospitalizations. Regions with underfunded school districts showed corresponding spikes in preventable disease burden (p < 0.01).

policy_implication: Findings emphasize the need for cross-sector policy solutions in Illinois including Medicaid expansion, educational reform, and targeted public health investments in low-income neighborhoods.
references: Illinois Socioeconomic and Health Impact Report
